results.title: Space filling curves (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: William Hansard, Education Development Center and Topology Films Project
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Geometry”.
Using computer animation the concept of a limit curve is graphically portrayed as a sequence of approximate curves and applied to the construction of space filling curves; curves which pass through every point in a square.

results.title: Family Court
results.creator_credit: Peter Campbell, Diane Sundin, Family Court of Australia and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 58 of Series “English at work”.
This video explains the role of the Family Court in divorce cases. It explains the grounds for applying for divorce, and the issues involved in a divorce in Australia. It also explains options offered by the Family Court after an application for divorce has been made: the structure of Information sessions, conciliation conferences, and court counsellors to help resolve differences in the main areas of dispute; children and property.

results.title: Prejudice: equality ...at what price
results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, Pamela Williams and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A provocative docu-drama portraying two cases of female discrimination experienced by separate women from unrelated backgrounds. Jessica, a newspaper photographer is subjected to a campaign of sexual harassment and Letitia is denied a promotion and subjected to humiliating racist comments from her colleagues. The stories are linked by the Anti-Discrimination Board, established to investigate and conciliate complaints of prejudice and discrimination. Combines the use of actors and “actual” professional people including Officers of the ADB, union representatives and members of the legal profession play themselves.

results.title: Communicating change
results.creator_credit: Diane Sundin, Australia Post and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “English at work”.
This program examines the issues of managing change in the workplace. It shows the importance for everyone in the workplace to understand what changes are going to happen, why they are happening and how everyone will be affected by them.

results.title: Journey to the centre of a triangle (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bruce Cornwell, Katharine Cornwell and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Geometry”.
Examines the incentre, circumcentre, the centroid, and the orthocentre of triangles. Visual constructions illustrate each kind of centre, and several examples are used to show how each is determined. Without narration. For beginning geometry students.

results.title: Proof (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jocelyn Moorhouse, Lynda House and House and Moorhouse Films
results.brief_description: Winner of 7 Australian Film Institute awards, “Proof” is a provocative and engrossing film about a man’s obsessive search for truth. Martin (Hugo Weaving) has been blind from birth. He trusts no-one, except for the camera which has replaced his eyes. His photos are proof that the world he senses is the same as other people see. Then he meets a young kitchen hand, Andy, whose honesty and kindness allow Martin to trust for the first time - until Martin’s jealous housekeeper, Celia, sets out to destroy this relationship. Written and directed by Jocelyn Moorhouse who won a 1992 Victorian Premier’s Literary Award for her screenplay.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jocelyn Moorhouse, Lynda House and House and Moorhouse Films

results.title: Proof
results.creator_credit: Jocelyn Moorhouse, Lynda House, Australian Film Commission, Film Victoria and House and Moorhouse Films
results.brief_description: Winner of 7 Australian Film Institute awards, “Proof” is a provocative and engrossing film about a man’s obsessive search for truth. Martin (Hugo Weaving) has been blind from birth. He trusts no-one, except for the camera which has replaced his eyes. His photos are proof that the world he senses is the same as other people see. Then he meets a young kitchen hand, Andy, whose honesty and kindness allow Martin to trust for the first time - until Martin’s jealous housekeeper, Celia, sets out to destroy this relationship. Written and directed by Jocelyn Moorhouse who won a 1992 Victorian Premier’s Literary Award for her screenplay. Cast also includes Genevieve Picot, Russell Crowe, heather Mitchell, Jeffrey Walker, Saskia Post, Frankie J. Holden.

results.title: Promises, promises: small town survival
results.creator_credit: Reevan Dolgoy, Roger Hart and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film exploring the problems and potential’s of small towns in the Drumheller Valley region of Alberta. It documents the citizen participation generated in the region by the Task Force on Urbanisation and the Future, the citizens’ reaction to curtailment of the Task Force exercise, the events that followed, and the lesson of this experience for other districts facing similar problems.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Reevan Dolgoy, Roger Hart and National Film Board of Canada
